description: Assesses a scene focused on dialogue

levels.4: Dialogue punctuated correctly throughout; no errors
levels.3: Minor punctuation errors that don't impede reading
levels.2: Multiple punctuation errors; some confusion about who's speaking

feedback_stems.growth: Remember: punctuation goes inside quotation marks, and new speaker = new paragraph

levels.4: Each character sounds distinctly different; could identify speaker without tags
levels.2: Characters sound similar; minimal voice distinction

feedback_stems.strength: Each character sounded unique, like when
feedback_stems.growth: Give each character their own way of talking—word choice, sentence length, vocabulary

levels.4: Effective mix of dialogue tags and action beats; 'said' used appropriately
levels.3: Good variety in how dialogue is attributed
levels.2: Over-reliance on 'said' or overuse of fancy tags ('exclaimed,' 'shouted')

feedback_stems.strength: Great use of action beats instead of tags, like
feedback_stems.growth: Try using action beats (what characters do while talking) to vary your dialogue

levels.4: Dialogue reveals character AND advances plot; every line serves a purpose
levels.2: Some dialogue feels like filler or doesn't add much
levels.1: Dialogue doesn't serve the story; could be removed without impact

feedback_stems.strength: Your dialogue did double duty—it revealed character while moving the plot
feedback_stems.growth: Each line of dialogue should either show us who a character is or move the story forward
